str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A dwelling; by implication, a family.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Lit: I dip, submerge, but specifically of ceremonial dipping; I baptize.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To remain, abide, stay, wait; with acc: I wait for, await. A primary verb; to stay.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A dwelling; by implication, a family.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To urge, press, constrain by entreaties. From para and the middle voice of biazo; to force contrary to, i.e. Compel.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
